title: Privacy by design
description: Privacy by Design (PbD) is an approach in system engineering that takes privacy into account throughout the whole engineering process. PbD especially focuses on systems or applications that capture and process personal data. As an organization you must understand what data protection regulations you must adhere to (GDPR, CCPA, LGPD, POPIA, etc.) and implement them into your solution accordingly.

title: Classify and protect data
description: Implement data classification schemes to categorize data based on sensitivity levels. Apply appropriate protection mechanisms such as encryption, access controls, and data masking based on the classification. Use services like Amazon Macie to automatically discover and classify sensitive data.

title_full: DALSEC03-BP03 Understand data classifications and their protection policies
title: Understand data classifications and their protection policies
description: Data classifications are essential to protect data and determine access permissions throughout the analytics workflow. Define clear classification levels and corresponding protection policies. Ensure all team members understand how to handle data at each classification level.

title_full: DALSEC03-BP04 Identify the source data owners and have them set the data classifications
title: Identify the source data owners and have them set the data classifications
description: Assign owners to each dataset in the Data Catalog. Data owners are responsible for setting data classifications and defining access policies. Define attestation scopes and reviewers for sensitive data, and set expiry for data ownership and attestation to ensure ongoing governance.

title_full: DALSEC03-BP05 Record data classifications into the Data Catalog so that analytics workload can understand
title: Record data classifications into the Data Catalog so that analytics workload can understand
description: Store data classification metadata in a centralized Data Catalog such as AWS Glue Data Catalog or AWS Lake Formation. This enables analytics workloads to programmatically understand data sensitivity and apply appropriate handling procedures automatically.

title: Implement encryption policies
description: Implement encryption for data at rest and in transit based on data classification requirements. Use AWS Key Management Service (KMS) to manage encryption keys. Define key rotation policies and access controls for cryptographic materials.

title_full: DALSEC03-BP07 Implement data retention policies for each class of data in the analytics workload
title: Implement data retention policies for each class of data in the analytics workload
description: Define and implement data retention policies based on data classification, regulatory requirements, and business needs. Automate data lifecycle management using Amazon S3 Lifecycle policies and similar mechanisms to ensure data is retained appropriately and deleted when no longer needed.

title_full: DALSEC03-BP08 Enforce downstream systems to honor the data classifications
title: Enforce downstream systems to honor the data classifications
description: Ensure that downstream systems consuming analytics data maintain the same data classification and protection policies. Implement technical controls to prevent data from being copied to systems with lower security standards. Use AWS Clean Rooms for secure data collaboration without exposing raw data.

title_full: DALSEC04-BP01 Allow data owners to determine which people or systems can access data
title: Allow data owners to determine which people or systems can access data
description: An analytics workload is a centralized repository of data from different source systems. As the analytics workload owner, honor the source systems' access management policies when connecting to and ingesting from source systems. Enable data owners to define and control access to their data in analytics and downstream workloads.

title_full: DALSEC04-BP02 Build user identity solutions that uniquely identify people and systems
title: Build user identity solutions that uniquely identify people and systems
description: Implement identity management solutions that uniquely identify all users and systems accessing analytics data. Use federated identity with SAML or OIDC for human users and IAM roles for system access. Ensure all access can be attributed to specific identities for audit purposes.

title_full: DALSEC04-BP03 Implement the required data authorization models
title: Implement the required data authorization models
description: Implement appropriate authorization models for your analytics workload using services like AWS Lake Formation for fine-grained access control. Support column-level, row-level, and cell-level security as needed. Use tag-based access control for scalable permission management.

title_full: DALSEC04-BP04 Establish an emergency access process to ensure admin access is managed
title: Establish an emergency access process to ensure admin access is managed
description: Define and document emergency access procedures for situations requiring elevated privileges. Implement break-glass procedures with appropriate logging and approval workflows. Ensure emergency access is time-limited and audited.

title_full: DALSEC04-BP05 Track data and database changes
title: Track data and database changes
description: Implement change tracking and auditing for data and database modifications. Use database audit logs, change data capture, and AWS CloudTrail to maintain a complete record of all changes for compliance and troubleshooting purposes.

title_full: DALSEC05-BP01 Prevent unintended access to the infrastructure
title: Prevent unintended access to the infrastructure
description: Analytics environments change based on the evolving requirements of data processing and data distribution. Ensure the environment is accessible with the least permissions necessary. Implement network security controls, security groups, and VPC configurations to prevent unauthorized infrastructure access.

title_full: DALSEC05-BP02 Implement least privilege policies for source and downstream systems
title: Implement least privilege policies for source and downstream systems
description: Apply least privilege principles to all access between analytics systems and source or downstream systems. Grant only the minimum permissions required for each integration. Regularly review and right-size permissions.

title_full: DALSEC05-BP03 Monitor infrastructure changes and user activities
title: Monitor infrastructure changes and user activities
description: Automate the auditing of environment changes and generate alerts for abnormal environment access. Use AWS CloudTrail, AWS Config, and Amazon CloudWatch to monitor and alert on infrastructure changes and suspicious user activities.

title_full: DALSEC05-BP04 Secure the audit logs that record data or resource access
title: Secure the audit logs that record data or resource access
description: Protect audit logs from tampering or unauthorized access. Store logs in a separate account or with immutable storage settings. Implement log integrity validation and ensure logs are retained according to compliance requirements.
